definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
classifier for hair or grass: tuft/Taiwan pr. [cuo4]
to pick up (a powder etc) with the fingertips/to scoop up/to collect together/to extract/to gather up/classifier: pinch/Taiwan pr. [cuo4]

sentences.english: Cut the shrimps in half and marinate with pinchof salt and pepper for about 5 minutes.
sentences.chinese: 虾仁切半，用一小撮食盐和胡椒粉腌制5分钟。

sentences.english: They constitute but a handful of the number.
sentences.chinese: 他们只不过是其中的一小撮。

sentences.english: Add a pinch of salt to the egg whites and beat until stiff.
sentences.chinese: 蛋白加入一小撮食盐，打至硬身全发。

sentences.english: A small group of dissatisfied officers intrigued against the government.
sentences.chinese: 一小撮不满的官员们谋反政府。

sentences.english: A few die-hards are trying to stop the reforms.
sentences.chinese: 一小撮死硬派企图中止改革。

sentences.english: I stopped a little way off and studied the small group of mourners.
sentences.chinese: 我维持着一个观望的距离，研究着这一小撮哀悼者。

sentences.english: Only a handful of people were dead set on following him.
sentences.chinese: 死心塌地跟他走的只是一小撮。

sentences.english: It's just a bunch of bankers and executives doing their thing.
sentences.chinese: 它不过是一小撮银行家们与公司高层之间的勾当而已。

sentences.english: The state is ruled by a handful of feudal satraps.
sentences.chinese: 国家由一小撮封建集团统治着。

sentences.english: There the small band of warrior monks established a headquarters.
sentences.chinese: 一小撮信教的武士为此建立了一个指挥部。

sentences.english: He had at that moment a powder train of friends scattered all over Paris.
sentences.chinese: 这时，安灼拉那一小撮火药似的朋友正分赴巴黎各处。

sentences.english: A Cuban wake up meal – usually consists of sweetened coffee with milk with a pinch of salt thrown in.
sentences.chinese: 通常包括加糖，加牛奶，还放一小撮盐的咖啡。

sentences.english: Do it for me at once, " said Abraham, stroking the goatee on his chin."
sentences.chinese: 阿伯拉汉边说边摸著下巴的一小撮山羊胡子。

sentences.english: A handful of billionaires have shoved a spanner into the legislative process.
sentences.chinese: 一小撮亿万富翁已经开始插手立法程序。

sentences.english: All the trouble are caused by a handful of malcontent.
sentences.chinese: 这些是非都是由一小撮不满分子搬弄的。

sentences.english: All the trouble is being caused by a handful of malcontent.
sentences.chinese: 这些麻烦都是由一小撮不满分子造成的。

definition: to scatter/to break sth up/to beat (an egg)
muddy/covered in (mud, dust, sweat, blood etc)/daubed in
spoon/ladle/CL:把[ba3]/abbr. for 公勺[gong1 shao2], centiliter (unit of volume)
to seize/to clutch/to grab firmly and pull
